sectionText: Topic:  Panama Papers and a Global History of Money Laundering, Tax Avoidance, and Offshoring Description: The Panama Papers, the leaked documents of the law firm Mossack Fonsecka, revealed the close linkages between global finance, legitimate and criminal wealth, political corruption, and international property and asset markets.  This course will historicize the Panama Papers by examining the global history of finance from the eighteenth century to the present.  We will examine changes in the ways in which businessmen, politicians, bankers, financiers, and lawyers moved wealth across long-distances and between sovereign governments over the past three centuries.
